Boesenbergia rotunda (fingerroot) belongs to the ginger family (Z ingiberaceae). This herb is widely used culinarily in China and Southeast Asia. Extracts of fingerroot rhizomes are well-known for its various pharmacological effects such as anti-allergic
30 , antibacterial
31, 32 , antioxidant
33 , and anti-tumor activities
34, 35 . Among the major active ingredients found in fingerroot, panduratin A, a prenylated cyclohexenyl chalcone, has been reported to possibly exhibit the antiviral activity against HIV-1 and dengue virus (DENV)
